intro: Epilobium coloratum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers have four petals and are typically arranged in elongated inflorescences. Epilobium coloratum f. albiflorum thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, streambanks, and woodland edges.
